title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 300.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 300.1 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Approaches
shall mean all plazas and roadways leading to or from the Atlantic Beach

Bridge, over which the authority exercises jurisdiction. (b) Authority shall mean the Nassau County

Bridge Authority. (c) Bridge shall
mean the Atlantic Beach Bridge, located between Lawrence and Atlantic Beach, Nassau County, NY. (d) Manager shall
mean the manager of the Nassau County Bridge Authority; or the employee
performing his functions for the time being. (e) Parking shall mean the halting of a
vehicle on a roadway while not actually engaged in the payment of a toll or in
obedience to traffic regulations, traffic signs or signals, and regardless of
whether or not the driver remains in the vehicle. (f) Police department shall mean the Nassau

County Police Department. (g) Semitrailer shall mean a vehicle not self-propelled, designed and constructed
to be towed and to move with the forward end of its body or chassis resting
upon the body or chassis of the towing vehicle. (h) Toll booth shall mean a structure used by
the authority for the collection of tolls. (i) Toll force shall mean the uniformed
employees normally assigned to collection of tolls, including their uniformed
supervisors, as well as the manager and assistant managers. (j) Tractor shall mean a motor vehicle
designed for drawing other vehicles and having no provision for carrying loads
independently. (k) Traffic shall
include pedestrians, ridden animals, and vehicles whether moved by human power
or otherwise. (l) Trailer shall mean
a vehicle (other than a semitrailer) not self-propelled, designed and
constructed to be towed. (m) Trip
shall mean a one-way passage over the Atlantic Beach Bridge. (n) Truck shall mean a motor vehicle (other
than a passenger automobile or motorcycle) designed or used for the
transportation of goods, wares and merchandise, or registered for such
use. (o) Velocipede shall include a
bicycle, tricycle or other light vehicle propelled by the rider or
riders. Notes

300.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
